summary:
Curiosity is a key word for me. I’ve always been curious about the world and how everything works. I like to go into depth and use my analytical abilities, but at the same time I like to work on the bigger picture. I am a very communicative, positive and social person that gets energy from working together. Variety in my work is important to me and my ability to learn quickly and result-driven personality help me to be successful in this. During the TNO traineeship I developed into a more self-conscious person, knowing my abilities, energizers and boundaries. At Orikami, I have further developed my data science and consultancy skills. In this job I was both working on algorithm development and the higher strategic picture- and user experience design of smart solutions. 

Currently at Demcon I am still exploiting my qualities: combining detailed technical knowledge on machine learning and my strategic- and communicative skills to get the best solutions for our customers. This time in an engineering field where we as Demcon also make the hardware.

awards.title: Bronze medal 2nd IJSO
awards.description: The International Junior Science Olympiad is a competition for young students (15 or younger) to compete in tests in the field of Biology, Chemistry and Physics. I was one of the 6 representatives for the Netherlands at the 2nd IJSO in Yogjakarta.

profile_positions.description:
As application specialist AI at Demcon Data Driven Solutions I work in the field of Artificial Intelligence and machine learning for mechatronic systems. I have a diverse role, from spotting opportunities for the use of AI, to consultancy, to development of courses on machine learning to programming ML algorithms. This way my hunger to innovative- and diverse work is satisfied as well as the desire to both go into depth technically and look at a more strategic level. 

At Demcon data driven solutions I work on:
- increasing functionality of mechatronic systems by advanced time series analysis, for example by using recurrent neural networks to classify medical events
- machine vision applications combining state of art convolutional neural networks with synthetic data to create more robust algorithms
profile_positions.title: Application specialist AI

profile_positions.description: At Orikami I work as a Senior Consultant Data Science which means I am technically involved with data analyses (statistics, machine learning), building data strategies and developing product concepts (human-centered design) for organisations in healthcare. For example I have been involved in projects with Hersenz, St. Maartenskliniek, Pluryn, Vilans and Janssen.
profile_positions.title: Senior Consultant Data Science

profile_positions.description: Team lead of Orikami's consultancy team. which involves strategic development of the team, being part of the management board, and guidance of team members in their work and personal development.
profile_positions.title: Team Lead

profile_positions.description: At Orikami I work as a Data Strategist which means I am both technically involved with data analyses but furthermore I am working on building solid data strategies for organisations in healthcare. For example I have been involved in projects with Hersenz, St. Maartenskliniek, Pluryn, and Vilans and Janssen.
profile_positions.title: Data Scientist and Data Strategist

profile_positions.description:
Taking a year off to follow my passion for travelling. This has been a character building experience which has enhanced my self knowledge, patience and cultural awareness. A few highlights have been:

- Motorbiking about 6000km through Vietnam
- Completing 2 diving courses and doing >30 dives in Thailand, Malaysia and Indonesia
- Trekking over 250km in the Himalayas in Nepal
- Completing a ten-day Vipassana Meditation Course in Malaysia
profile_positions.title: Traveler

profile_positions.description:
The TNO traineeship is a two year-program with a strong focus on both professional and personal development. In these two years I have visited 3 different departments, working as scientist/innovator, business developer and project manager. Besides the department work, trainees are involved in TNO-wide business strategy projects. For personal development trainees are having peer review sessions, personal coaching and full day trainings. Below I summarized my activities.

 1) Equipment for Additive Manufacturing, @Eindhoven (November 2014 - June 2015)
The first months I worked as a scientist/innovator at the EfAM department of TNO. I was responsible for setting up a project and collaboration involving additive manufacturing (3D-printing) and biological research at TNO in the field of 'Organ on a Chip'-research. Besides this project I worked on evaluating machine requirements&specifications for a next generation metal additive manufacturing machine.

2) Nano- Instrumentation, @Delft (July 2015 - February 2016)
My second department, Nano-Instrumentation focuses on contamination control for the semiconductor industry. I worked as a scientist/innovator on the development of real-time sensor for molecular contamination in vacuum and the realization of an experimental facility for measuring particle generation in vacuum robots. Most of my work involved computional calculations and simulations with COMSOL.

3) Thin Film Technology (Solliance), @Eindhoven (March 2016 - October 2016)
The department of thin film technology of TNO is part of the Solliance organization, a joint innovation centre by IMEC, ECN and TNO. At Solliance I worked both as a scientist and as a business developer, about 50:50. The scientific work I did is on two topics: 1) the reliability of CIGS photovoltaic modules and 2) the fabrication of translucent solar cells. As a business developer I was involved in the continuous development of the different value propositions and strategic course of Solliance.
profile_positions.title: Trainee

Mathematics 1,2,3 and 4, Thermodynamics 2, Mechanics 1

profile_positions.description:
A 4 months research internship at the department of Bio- Organic Chemistry under supervision of prof. dr. Jan van Hest en dr. Rene Brinkhuis. Thesis Title: "Label exchange at functionalized polymersomes". 
Grade: 9 out of 10
profile_positions.title: Bachelor's research internship

profile_positions.description:
One year's research internship at the HFML,a unique research institute in the Netherlands runned by FOM and the RU. My project was about the selection of supramolecular chirality by rotational and magnetic forces under supervision of dr. P.G. van Rhee and prof. dr. P.C.M. Christianen. Thesis title: "Aggregation kinetics in a chiral selection process"
Grade: 9 out of 10
profile_positions.title: Master's research intership
